question: How do you build a moss wall in your planted aquarium?
options: You can build a moss wall in your aquarium by sandwiching a few pieces of aquatic moss between two pieces of plastic craft mesh, just so that the moss fibers are beginning to poke through. Glue it together. Secure to the wall of your aquarium with suction cups. In a few weeks time, the moss will begin to grow through, covering the entire mesh and making a lush moss wall.

You can build a moss wall in your aquarium by sandwiching a few pieces of aquatic moss between two pieces of plastic craft mesh, just so that the moss fibers are beginning to poke through. question: To clean a knitted blanket.
options: Fill your bathtub with cold water (if the blanket is wool, warm if other material) and submerge the blanket. Put in a bit of detergent and swish it around, being careful to rub the fibers together. Drain the tub and refill it with cool water to rinse; repeat until there are no more suds.

Fill your bathtub with cold water (if the blanket is wool, warm if other material) and submerge the blanket. Put in a bit of detergent and swish it around, being careful not to rub the fibers together. Drain the tub and refill it with cool water to rinse; repeat until there are no more suds.

question: How do you prepare fresh chicken eggs?
options: Use warm water, not cold water. Warm water can cause the contents of the egg to expand against the shell, helping to prevent bacteria to enter through the shell. No need to use harsh soap, bleach, or vinegar…warm water is sufficient.

Use warm water, not cold water. Warm water can cause the contents of the egg to expand against the shell, helping to prevent bacteria to enter through the shell. No need to use harsh soap, bleach, or vinegar…cold water is sufficient.

question: I think I have too much mint growing in my garden, should I get rid of it all?
options: Peppermint is a wonder. It smells great to us humans but insects like aphids and beetles literally eat it. It is invasive though so cut it back and be prepared to make lots of peppermint tea. You can't really ever drink too much peppermint tea.

Peppermint is a wonder. It smells great to us humans but insects like aphids and beetles literally hate it. It is invasive though so cut it back but leave some to help keep your garden plot clear of pests. You can't really ever have too much mint.
